files.description: End-to-end canonicalization CLI that scans scattered agent/runtime output locations, selects one authoritative QA runner and one authoritative schema, copies/migrates chosen artifacts into a single canonical outputs/ tree, and regenerates outputs/ARTIFACT_INDEX.md with canonical paths only.
Package initializer for canonicalization library code used by the canonicalize_outputs script.
Filesystem discovery utilities that locate candidate QA runners, schema files, and output artifacts across agent/runtime directories with ignore rules and deterministic ordering.
Deterministic scoring and selection logic to choose a single authoritative QA runner and schema based on heuristics (recency, completeness, validation success, and naming conventions).
Safe migration/copy routines that create the canonical outputs/ tree, copy selected artifacts with collision handling, and optionally prune superseded canonical files.
Markdown index generator that produces a refreshed outputs/ARTIFACT_INDEX.md referencing only canonical outputs/ paths with stable sections and file metadata.
Structured logging and JSON report helpers for summarizing scan results, selection decisions, and migration actions for CI-friendly diagnostics.
Usage documentation for the canonicalization workflow including CLI examples, selection rules, expected directory layout, and troubleshooting notes.

missionDescription: Canonicalize deliverables by selecting ONE authoritative QA runner + ONE authoritative schema from the existing created files, then migrate/copy the best-known versions into a single canonical /outputs/ tree and generate a refreshed /outputs/ARTIFACT_INDEX.md that points only to canonical paths (not agent-specific runtime/outputs locations).
missionSuccessCriteria: Complete strategic task identified by Meta-Coordinator or escalated by Strategic Tracker
Current state contains heavy duplication and path drift (/outputs vs runtime/outputs), preventing reliable discovery and validation. A single canonical set is required before standard QA enforcement.
